data.title: Professional Black Car drivers resources
data.text:
All Black Car drivers must meet Lyft’s standard driver requirements for their region. In some cities, only Professional Black Car drivers who meet elevated document requirements are able to give Black rides or perform pickups at select airport zones.

Use the ‘Contact Us’ button at the bottom of this page to verify your professional credentials as a Black Car driver.

Owner operators or independent drivers that aren't associated with a Fleet company can use the 'Contact Us' button at the bottom of this page with questions.

If you’re a Professional Black Car driver that's already on the Lyft platform, use the ‘Contact Us’ button at the bottom of this page to verify your professional credentials.

If you’re a Professional Black Car driver that isn't already on the Lyft platform, complete a Lyft driver application to get started.

If you’re a Black Car fleet manager or the sole proprietor of a Black Car business, and you're interested in partnering with Lyft, apply by visiting our Black Car Fleets page.

Note: Once your drivers accept the fleet invite, they won't be able to drive a personal vehicle. If they want to leave the fleet to drive a personal vehicle, use the ‘Contact Us’ button at the bottom of this page for assistance.

Drivers must meet all standard requirements for being a Lyft driver in addition to providing or maintaining:
